isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Assembly and Installation - Adjust Wheel Bearings

warning.para: When performing a wheel bearing adjustment:

item.para: Always use the correct size wrench socket (Figure 47).
Always use a torque wrench to tighten the adjusting nuts to their correct adjusting torques.

Never attempt to tighten or loosen the adjusting nuts by either hitting them directly with a hammer or by hitting a chisel or a drift placed against them with a harnmer. Failure to do this can damage the nuts, prevent a proper wheel bearing adjustment from being achieved, and cause possible loss of vehicle wheel-end equipment and serious personal injury.

figure.caption: Figure 47. Use Correct Size Wrench Socket

step1.para: Tighten the adjusting nut to 100 lbf-ft (136 Nm) torque while the hub is being rotated eight revolutions (minimum) to be sure that all bearing and seal surfaces are seated correctly. Back off one full turn and retighten the adjusting nut to 50 lbf-ft (68 Nm).
Back off the adjusting nut 1/5 turn.
Assemble the lock ring and jam nut. Tighten the jam nut to 250-400 lbf-ft (339-542 Nm). The resulting end play must be within 0.001- to 0.010-inch (0.025-0.254 mm). Readjust if necessary.
